ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Rogues and bards (was Why didn't I log out sooner?)
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Rats!  Almost 14 months into this game and I m still a newbie!  Heh heh. ... NEVER DESTROY COPPERS!!  Kindly drop them near zone edges when poor newbies
ygData.messageBody:
> From: Perhaps a Princess... [mailto:sarah@...]
> Actually, by "True newbie" I meant at levels 1-15 or so.

Rats! Almost 14 months into this game and I'm still a newbie! Heh heh.

> About the point
> when you start getting enough loot between trips back to town
> (And you're
> far enough away from town) That you destroy coppers to save
> the weight and
> keep you light on your feet.

NEVER DESTROY COPPERS!! Kindly drop them near zone edges when poor newbies
like me can pick them up (said the encumbered bard twisting Selo's & Chant
all the way from Oasis to Freeport bank <g>)

> Twinked or not, ALL my characters save every copper they can
> get -- until
> they run out of strength to carry it. And I haven't yet
> started throwing
> silvers away. That still feels like a sacrilege.

I'm worse, I have a hard time dropping fishing grubs.

> As a twink, I group with whoever I can find to group with. I
> don't look
> at equipment. Shoot, I don't know whether most of it is "good or bad"
> even. What I look at is first, personality. SOmeone I can get along
> with. and second, level range. Can I group with them. Occasionally,
> we'll be specifically looking for a tank-type, or a healer-type. Or
> a Snarer. But that's about it :)

It depends on your interests in the game. If you're playing to level, and
your twinked, then you're better off to play with other twinks. Likewise if
your class can solo yellows and your in a group pulling yellows, then you'd
be better off to solo (unless your seeing a huge reduction in downtime). I
don't hold it against people who choose to play this way.

Personally I look at level first. I level extremely slowly, so if I can
group with someone who's a lower level than me, there's a chance that I
might still be within grouping level range with them the next time we're
both on. Personality matters, but that's not as quickly apparent. Class
doesn't matter at all. I like to experiment with different group make ups
and find ways to make each combo work.

Peace
Evulia, bard of 11 missed notes, Tunare
